Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline and of rosette in white outline with added red centres; exterior: at rim diagonal strokes between pairs of bands above elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 261, no. 521)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0481) (phase 2)
